title: Ruled By Madness
opening: The capital of Renais. After the twins’ absence, seeing their home ruined by war brings them terrible grief. Orson, a former Knight of Renais, has been assigned to guard Castle Renais. However, he switched allegiances, betraying his oaths of loyalty to his homeland. Eirika marks her homecoming by vowing to see Renais healed.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Brother...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: What has happened to our home? What has happened to Castle Renais? How did it come to be so ruined? So desolated?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Spies report that the castle is being held by the traitor Orson.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Orson... In retrospect, I realize he’s been acting odd for a while now. He seemed so... dispirited.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: His wife passed away some six months back. The loss may have been too much for his mind to bear. His love and devotion for his wife were well known among the knights.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Now, he sits alone in the king’s former bedchambers. He makes no effort to govern. No one is allowed to enter the chambers, and he takes no meals.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What could he possibly be doing?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: I do not know. The spies had no insight into his behavior. He does nothing to deal with the dark creatures and bandits roaming the land. Reports say all of Renais is engulfed in chaos. Region after region is revolting, and Orson’s reign is already crumbling. Left alone, it may very well collapse under the weight of its own neglect.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: We cannot allow the situation to reach that point. We’re going home, Eirika. We’re going to the castle.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: I hear you, Ephraim.

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: Um, Ephraim?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: What is it, Myrrh?

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: I-I will fight with you. Now that Selena has returned my dragonstone to me... I’ll do what I can until its power runs out. Let’s take back your home.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Are you sure about this?

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: For the two of you... I simply want to help.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: All right. I understand. But you must make me a promise. You are never to stray from our sides. Got that?

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: Of course...

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: What is it, Monica? You seem so happy today. Of COURSE I know what today is. I’d never forget your birthday! I have a present for you, dear. I think you’ll like it....

intro.speaker: Guard
intro.line: You know something? That Orson... He gives me the creeps. What do you think he’s doing back there? I’ve heard lots of bizarre rumors from the master of the mess hall. ...Do you think he needs help? Could he be dangerous?

intro.speaker: Guard
intro.line: I don’t care. I’m here for the money. As long as I get paid, I’m happy. But on the subject of rumors, have you heard the stories of the secret treasure? There’s supposed to be some fabulous wealth hidden in Castle Renais. I tell you, if I find it, I’m gone.

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: It does my heart good to see you looking so happy, Orson. See what joy your treachery has brought you? I told you treason would be sweet.

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: Get out. This is Monica and my place. I will not have our home disturbed by anyone. I did as you asked. I betrayed Renais. My promise has been kept.

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh?How long are you going to continue this nonsense? Eirika and Ephraim have joined forces. Even now, their united forces march toward the capital, toward you.

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: Eirika?

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: You can’t imagine they’ll forgive you for your treachery, can you? I expect the sin of your betrayal has shattered you entire family’s name. And after all you did to free your wife from the cold clutches of the grave?It’s a shame she’ll be sent back there dangling from the hangman’s noose.

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: No! That can’t happen–

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh! Oh, but it can, and it will. Unless you do something to stop it. You understand what is required, don’t you? You have your orders, Orson. Heh heh heh

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: ...Monica, I’m sorry. I have something I must do. Please wait for me here. Oh, darling, don’t look so sad. I’ll be back soon, and then I’ll never leave. I must do this to protect our happiness. You understand that, don’t you? All right then. I’ll be back.

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh! He believes that thing is his wife! Aren’t people amusing?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Urr? Why? This terrible? Uh! Urr? gaa? Ahh

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Oh my, your nasty little illness rearing its ugly little head again? There’s no need to worry. The pain will pass shortly. Leave everything to your humble servant, Riev. Heh heh heh!

boss.speaker: Orson
boss.line: ...I won’t let you come between us. Monica and I will live here happily together. Forever...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. The castle has been secured. And...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: ...This way. This is the room Orson was holed up in.

end.speaker: Monica
end.line: ...Darling...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You, you’re Orson’s...

end.speaker: Monica
end.line: Darling. Darling. Darling...darling...darling...darling...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: ...What?! This...is horrible...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: This same magic was used to control Emperor Vigarde. She’s already dead, and her corpse was used to...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Who? Who could...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You needn’t look any longer, Eirika. Let’s go outside.

end.speaker: Monica
end.line: Darling. Darling...darling...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: ...You can’t say this thing is truly alive anymore. I’ll...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: No... I’ll do it. ...The two of them spent every day in here, did they? Orson was mad. But I think he was happy...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We’ve finally made it back. Yet...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Mmm... We can repair the castle, and what was stolen, we can do without. But the wounds and suffering inflicted upon the people of Renais...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: It’s too late to undo their pain. Once I become king, I must set our country right. I doubt the people will give me a warm reception, though. I did abandon them. All I can do is try to win back their trust, no matter how long it takes...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Princess Eirika, Prince Ephraim. You should look outside.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Outside?

end.speaker: People
end.line: Prince Ephraim! Princess Eirika! The king has returned! Our king! Glory to Renais! Long live King Ephraim!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: ...They’re not cheering for you. They cheer because Orson’s misrule is at an end. They cheer the possibility of a better tomorrow, not the deeds we did today. But how will the hearts of the people move tomorrow and the next day? That is for you to decide.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I will not let their hopes and dreams be shattered again. I will be king. Like my father before me, I will dedicate myself to their happiness.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: And I will do all I can to help, Ephraim.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. Before Renais fell, King Fado entrusted me with this message: Raise the twins?bracelets in the hall of kings. The seal will be broken. The resting place of the Sacred Stone will be revealed...?br>

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I understand.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: So we’re supposed to raise our bracelets over our heads, right?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Let’s try it, Eirika.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I’m ready, Ephraim.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: This is the Stone of Renais...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes. This is one of the five stones that defeated the Demon King.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: If Lyon had acquired our bracelets, the stone would have been destroyed by now. Together, we protected the only power that can help us stop Lyon’s insanity.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes. It’s the only hope left to us. Hope for you and me, and the last true hope for peace...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Let’s get back, Eirika.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: ...Huh? Brother, look! Our bracelets, they’re...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: What is this? Are they reacting to the light of the stone? Eirika’s Lunar Brace and Ephraim’s Solar Brace glow in response to the Sacred Stone. With the power of the bracelets, the twins can now change classes.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I can’t believe the bracelets contain so much power...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I wonder if Father anticipated all of this long ago. When I was growing up, I never thought about becoming king. I only wanted to be a good soldier, a good warrior. The best on the battlefield. Father never understood what I wanted, but... I never understood him, either.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: It was the same when Grado invaded Renais. I should have stayed home to defend the kingdom... Instead, I raced off to fight for personal glory.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Brother... I don’t think you know how well Father understood your feelings. When I last saw him, he was concerned for nothing but our safety...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Eirika is correct. King Fado asked after your exploits every day. He always told me what a fine king you would one day make.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Father...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Now Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. Please follow me. The Sacred Twins of Renais should be near the stone’s reliquary.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Ah, here we go. This lance can only be one of the Sacred Twins of Renais. Please, Prince Ephraim, take this sacred relic and feel its weight.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: So this is one of our Sacred Twin relics, is it? I’ve never seen them. Look, there’s a name inscribed here. Siegmund, the Flame Lance.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: And this blade is sister to the lance, the other Sacred Twin of legend. Princess Eirika, if you would?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Of course. There’s a name carved here as well. Sieglinde, the Thunder Blade...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: These are the ancient weapons of our ancestors–the weapons of heroes. They were enshrined generations ago, to be used only by the king... and only in times of dire need. Such an awful power they possess, and yet we need them to restore peace. I’ve seen enough of the horrors of war, but I can’t turn my back on it. If we merely turn our eyes away, we surrender our world to atrocity. And so, I must fight. I’ll do whatever I must do to bring back the peace we once knew.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: What is happening? Have you found the Sacred Stone?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes. Here it is...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Wow! It truly is spectacular. This goes some way to brighten the dark shadows that loom over us.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Our countries? Sacred Stones have been shattered by Grado’s men. The Stone of Renais is our last remaining weapon.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: No, it’s not. You have forgotten the stone of my beloved Rausten. Remember, there were five Sacred Stones for our five nations. The Stones of Grado, Frelia, and Jehanna are gone, but hope is not. We have the Stone of Renais, after all, and that of Rausten is safe. Our road is clear, my friends. I must guide you to Rausten.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: You’re right. L’Arachel, we’re counting on you to lead the way.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Of course. And you will all be welcome to stay in the palace. And, Eirika, you shall be my guest in my own private quarters! Let us be on our way.
